fields.summary: GreenHopper Card Flagging
Fix version with quotes in the name causes a broken query in issue navigator link
Missing first point on chart
Should not display "Selection successfully removed from Epic" if none was associated
Audit AUI messages and use the common AUI template

fields.description:
Our REST tests have a restore data functionality that uses the testkit library from JIRA to restore data in JIRA. By default this sets up JIRA with a starter license. However we configure GH with an unlimited license. This causes GH's UI to not work since the license types of GH and JIRA are not the same. 

Our REST tests do work because the REST resources don't do any license checking. The UI however redirects to the GH license page.

This is annoying because after running a test you may want to continue using your instance, but have to copy in an unlimited license for JIRA manually.

There must be a way in testkit to configure with what license JIRA is setup...
fields.summary: REST tests' restore configures JIRA with a starter license

fields.description: Would it be faster and more flexible to import the necessary data instead of restoring it from datasets that we can't easily edit because of how Mercurial handles binary files?
fields.summary: Investigate using JIM instead of Restore for integration tests

fields.description: As a scrum team member I want the priority of my stories to be reflected on the sprint board. The same way they are prioritized on the plan board.
fields.summary: Stories without subtasks retain their priority on the scrum board

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to delete completed sprints. We have three "test" sprints lying around that we created for testing purposes after installing greenhopper. It's quite annoying though

Please also see: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Deleting+a+Sprint that says: "Closed sprints cannot be deleted"

Any workaround to delete those sprints for now? Maybe directly in the DB?
fields.summary: As a project owner I'd like to delete completed sprints

fields.description:
Currently my team and a number of others I know list Acceptance criteria" for story by creating a list in the description field of the JIRA. This is too freeform and non exact.

One of the sub-tasks for the story would typically be to feature test the story for all the acceptance criteria in the list.

*It would be more ideal if were possible to build a list of Acceptance Criteria for a story which would show under the story similarly to sub tasks.* Each acceptance criteria could have a checkbox to indicate it was tested and on what date and any comments.
fields.summary: Add "Acceptance criteria" list to GreenHopper story

As Patrick, I want to use epics for swimlanes so I can see progress of each epic within a sprint more easily.

# Both stories and subtasks for the epics should display.
# Only an option for Scrum boards
# The swimlane presentation is similar to "story task" swimlane: Epic Name, possibly issue key
# No detail view shown for epic; clicking on swimlane selects first issue in swimlane (same as Assignee)
# Issues without epics shows at the bottom
fields.summary: Swimlane by epic

fields.description:
The new version of GreenHopper is awesome, however it's missing Release planning and reporting functionality or am I missing it? In previous versions we could associate sprints to a "Parent" release, though thats no longer available if using a Scrum Board. The Sprint burndown and end of sprint reports are great, I'd like to see something similar for Releases.

+For Example:+
* Release burndown chart by project, sprints, hours, story points and/or issues: The chart should allow me flip back and forth between different views right on the screen without a need for Admin permissions to change or access to the scrum board configuration settings. 
* The Release and Sprint burndown charts should be viewable on the dashboards

+Question:+
* Will the "Release" pull from the FixVersion field? If so, I'd like to suggest when building a Release I should be able pick from multiple projects and sprints. This might require an option to share a FixVersion across multiple projects.
fields.summary: As a User, I would like Release related reports & charts

fields.description: You cannot add sprint dates until you actually _start_ the sprint and that would be great to have as a functionality.

fields.summary: Sprint Report chart is not clear

We want to add our Developer and QA fileds in this view.

fields.description:
Currently, any scrum team members can include any issue types into an active sprint. It would be great if we could manage who/which groups/users to be able to include a specific issuetype into the Sprint.

For example, user A can only include issue type bugs into an active sprint.
fields.summary: Restricting groups/users from including certain issuetype to an active sprint

fields.description:
Hi,

We have a KB article here : https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Backlog+is+Empty+in+The+Scrum+Board.

This gives some reasons as to why the backlog of a Sprint can be empty.

Looking at specially these 2 points :
bq. Set the Sprint's custom field Search Template to GreenHopper Sprint Field Searcher, please refer to Configuring a Custom Field#SearchTemplate for more information.
bq. Make sure the sprint custom field is not hidden in the Field Configurations page.

I believe we should proactively check for these settings and provide warning messages to the user explaining the reasons why the Rapid board might be empty.

It is even more important because it could be really difficult to troubleshoot this.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Add warning message when Rapid board backlog is empty
plan mode: Adding an issue to a sprint when the issue will be filtered out results in an "Issue Not Found" error
If the version ends on a non working day, issues don't properly show up

fields.summary: Something is wrong with non working days
Kanban dots don't account for non-working days

fields.description:
Story swimlanes are default for Scrum but the parent story does not show the estimate unlike the sub-tasks below it. Since we advocate estimating on stories this seems like an oversight we should fix.

"I would like to see how many points each story is worth in the Work view. It comes up frequently in discussion how our progress is doing for story x (with x points) versus story y (with y points) and we need to select the story just to see (or go to the plan view). Having it display near the story name or somewhere in its section header bar would be very helpful."
fields.summary: As a user I want to see the estimate of a story easily in Work mode

fields.description:
The documentation about [Using GreenHopper Simplified Workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+GreenHopper+Simplified+Workflow] doesn't have a full explanation about the functionality.
This specific part states the following:

{quote}
GreenHopper Simplified Workflow offers the following benefits:
||GreenHopper Simplified Workflow||
|Has three default steps: *To Do*, *In Progress*, *Done*.|
{quote}

!doc.png|thumbnail!

GreenHopper Simplified Workflow will work on this way if you are using a *Scrum*, however once you create a board using *Kanban* the result is not the same:

!kanban.png|thumbnail!

Note that once applied the Simplified Workflow on Kanban will add 4 columns with different statuses:

||GreenHopper Kanban Simplified Workflow||
|Has four default steps: *Backlog*, *Selected for Development*, *In Progress*, *Done*|

We should add this information on the page for Kanban users.
fields.summary: Documentation update - Using GreenHopper Simplified Workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hi

I would like to start using the agile board but I have the problem that we estimate all the hours on sub-tasks and not on the user story itself. So the needed work should be always the sum of estimates on sub-tasks.

But as you can see on the two attached screenshot, the displayed estimation is 0h instead of 3d 5h 30m.

Could you please fix that? As I could see in other bug reports, this problem has already been fixed once, but it is there again.

Thanks & cheers
Martin
fields.summary: Sum of remaining estimate on sub-tasks not displayed on user story in agile boards

I cant seem to find any pattern other than I have a lot of inactive sprints. I have reindexed but this did not help.
I am using the latest version of greenhopper and JIRA 5.1.

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to have inline editing on the Issue Detailed View. For now, to edit an issue in JIRA Agile we need to open it on issue detailed view, click on the Cog Icon and then select "Edit" and the JIRA Edit Screen will be displayed.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have inline editing on the Issue Detailed View

fields.description:
The Board's Estimation/Time Tracking option is set to 'Remaining Estimate and Time Spent'

1) Create a subtask of a story in the active sprint
2) It's estimated time should be 10 hours
3) Log 5 hours
At this point the burndown should correctly log 5 hours spent and 5 remaining
4) Resolve the issue (leave 'Remaining Estimate' set to Adjust automatically and don't log any additional time)
The burndown chart will not remove the last 5 hours from 'Remaining Estimate' even though the JIRA issue correctly resets the remaining time to 0h

The workaround seems to be to either log work when closing an issue, or manually set the remaining time to 0 by logging work before closing the issue.  Once the issue is closed, it's a bit more work to fix the burndown chart (assuming you know which issues were improperly closed)
fields.summary: Burndown doesn't adjust remaining time when closing a task

fields.description:
* When a version filter is active, the epics which are not part of that version (by way of issues) are shown as "faded out"
** These faded out epics will still be interactive (drag and drop, filter toggling)
* Epic numbers metadata may be updated when filtering is active
* If an epic filter is active, and then a version filter is activated which excludes that epic, the epic filter will revert back to "All issues" option
* If a version filter is active, and a epic filtered for a an epic which has no issues in the currently selected version is selected, both filters are active and no results are shown

(!) Development Notes (!)
Q: Are there still drop zones for faded epics?
A: (/) Yes

Q: Will the epic unfade immediately if an issue is added?
A: (/) Yes

Q: Will the epic fade immediately when an issue is removed from it?
A: (/) Yes

Q: What happens if a quickfilter filters out all issues that are part of an epic?
A: (/) There will be no impact on the fading of the epics

Q: What if the instant filter is used?
A: (/) There will be no impact on the fading of the epics

Q: What happens when you "Create an issue in epic" for a faded epic?
A: (/) If the created issue has the fix version of the version being filtered, the epic will be unfaded because now it contains an issue with the correct version

Q: What happens if you create a new epic with a version selected? Is it born faded?
A: (/) It will be fade-born yes

Q: Do all faded epics unfade if you click the funnel?
A: (/) Yes

Q: Can you still modify faded epics through their dropdowns?
A: (/) Yes

Q: For all the files being touched, which other dependencies might be affected by changes?
A: (/) No impact on other files/components
fields.summary: As Patrick, I want the list of epics to reflect the current version filter

Cheers,

fields.description:
Epics are quite nice to structurize a project but Jira still lacks in transparency and usability concerning the link process and reporting capabilities. Here are my suggestions:

- Links between issues and epics should be visible in the "issue links" section
- In the "plan" view of the Rapid Board issues linked to an epic are only visible as long as they are in the backlog or in the current active sprint
- Adding an issue to an epic should be possible using the "link" command additionally to the existing "drag and drop" functionality in tha rapid board
fields.summary: The linking between epics and stories should be easier and more transparent

fields.description:
(this is not a duplicate, don't close)

Scrum does not have a prescription for neither road map development/oversight nor proper dependency management (between stories) for large projects, which would be grouped (in scrum speak) by epics. This shortfall in the methodology usually is solved by managing external, 10k foot, views on what needs to be done. This is done in road map documents, ms project, etc.

The only other agile methodology officially supported by jira now is Kanban, which is geared towards work similar to support and other operational-like tasks that are flowing in. Work managed by Kanban is not meant to be planned far ahead.

This Improvement request is meant to address necessary gap in jira's functionality and is a core feature that is necessity for any project substantial in size. This is not a request for additional plugin nor request for adding support for already existing one (for an On Demand setup).

1. Add a capability to import MS Project project.
2. Add a capability to export as MS Project project. 
3. Add a capability to sync with MS Project project.
4. Add a capability to visualize all (or filtered) stories/epics as Gantt chart
5. In Gantt chart story/epic view, add Predecessors capability with support for finish-to-start, finish-to-finish, start-to-start and start-to-finish, with lead and lag time offsets.
fields.summary: Add Gantt support
Spike: investigate the cost of inline edit in the detail view

fields.description: Apparently this config is in atlassian-plugin.xml. Check what option we need to set there to restrict our custom fields from being created
fields.summary: Lock down custom field creation

fields.description:
1. For fields with options (epic status):
If everything is 1:1 like the original configuration, then lock the field, otherwise don't lock the field

1a. Unless there is all projects/appropriate issues field scheme with ZERO options in there. In that case we will just add the options.

1b. Unless there are no schemes, in which case we introduce our own.

2. For fields without option fix up the contexts then lock the field

3. do NOT fix up field names/descriptions for any of the fields

3a. But fix the searcher.

4. for the Rank field, change managed level to "admin" (field creation) plus a message that the field should normally not be created as GH creates the field

5. The default rank field should be fixed up in context and then locked.
fields.summary: Fixing up of Epic Status field looses all current values

fields.description:
The "GreenHopper Classic Agile Gadget includes a progress bar with a legend that includes a count for the number of ToDo, InProgress, and Done issues, and the number in the count is actually a link to a filter result in the Issue Navigator (see attached).

At some point - maybe our last upgrade - these count links stopped working, and now cause and error like the one attached, where the server returns an "empty result". I noticed that if the &navInfo= parameter is removed from the URL, a normal Issue Navigator result is displayed.

Is this particular link no longer supported? Is it just broken, but if so, will it ever be fixed?

Thanks.

Tom

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 29 Oct 2013|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,

Thank you for your votes and comments on this feature request and also on the linked issues.

As our largest set of customers grow we know that there are several places in the JIRA user interface that become problematic. We want all our customers to be successful and we are committed to finding a good solution for these areas.

We do not have an exact release for when this will happen but we hope to deliver something simple in the near future. Below is a list of the most pressing areas that we see need a solution, if you have more that are urgent please let us know via the comments on JRA-24572:

* Admin - project list
* Admin - custom field list
* Admin - Manage agile boards
* User - Project list
* User - Board list

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,

Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Management
roy (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

*Original request description:*

It would be useful to have pagination on the new boards, when having a fairly long list of issues in there, and when ranking issues, it would be nice to be able to drag them to a specific page rather than across every issue in the board.
fields.summary: Add pagination to the new Boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-7661].
  {panel}

{noformat}No issues are assigned to a sprint with id 120
No issues are assigned to a sprint with id 132
No issues are assigned to a sprint with id 2{noformat}

An error will be thrown as above if user is trying to search using {{openSprints()}} query even if the user has specified the particular project that he/she has permission to browse.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a project A
# Create Scrum 1 for Project A
# Create two users where has the following
#- User 1 has permission to Project A
#- User 2 has no permission to Project A
# Create issues in Scrum 1 and include them in Sprint 1
# Login as User 1 and search for {{Sprint in openSprints()}} in Issue Navigator and you will be able to see the issues
# Login as User 2 and search for {{Sprint in openSprints()}} in Issue Navigator and you will be able to see the following error
{noformat}No issues are assigned to a sprint with id 1{noformat}

h3. Expected behaviour
The error should not be there and should just show that there is no issues found on the query.

h3. Extra info
The bug is only in GreenHopper 6.1.3.1. Tested in GreenHopper 6.0.8 and 6.1.2, the error does not persist.
fields.summary: Sprint in openSprints() throws error because no Browse Project permission

fields.description: Without Epic Links on Sub-tasks, custom swimlanes filtered by "Epic Link" exclude the sub-tasks. It would be great if whenever the Epic Link for a parent tasks was set/changed if it was automatically set/changed on the sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Add Epic Links to Sub-tasks: Custom swimlanes that filter by epic currently exclude sub-tasks

fields.description: (MR?)
fields.summary: document "locked down issue config"

fields.description:
As stated in [GHS-7652], in our company Epics stand for big features. So for now we use an Epic for each sub-feature and using labels for associating it to a main feature.
Sometimes - working on main releases and branches - it occurs that a Story affects more than one sub-feature. But for now it is not possible to actually associate that Story to more than one Epics (via Epic Link).
(It was possible doing that with the "old" Epic/Theme labels though.)
fields.summary: Associate a Story to more than one Epic

fields.description: As per the thread [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/137538/how-do-i-see-my-team-s-average-velocity], users would like to have the ability to see what their average velocity is, per day or week, to improve how many story points they should commit to in the next sprint duration.
fields.summary: Have the ability to see the average velocity per period of time in Velocity chart

fields.description:
In our company Epics stand for features. Those features extend over more than just one release (version). As there are huge features we would like do divide those into smaller sub-features to which we associate our Stories. Those Stories can still have even smaller Subtasks (which represent actual defined code).
For now it is not possible to associate Epics to another Epic (via Epic Link) for having kind of Sub-Epics,but we would love to be able to.
fields.summary: Associate Epics to an Epic

fields.description:
On the Plan Mode I see see the total story points as our team plans a sprint. But I would also find it valuable to see the total of all the time estimates in all of the issues.
Both metrics are important in planning because they show two different views of the work estimate.
fields.summary: As a product owner I want to see the estimated hours and story points total for a sprint when planning.

fields.description:
Currently, when creating issues on the planning board it's easy to create issues and accidentally forget to fill out certain required fields.

It would be nice to avoid this create-then-fixup loop, by either making it more prominent that an issue is not going to be visible after creation, making it harder to create issues that aren't visible or by making the post create fixup possible within GreenHopper. Ideas:

* Make it possible to configure default values for the issue create dialog for a given rapid board, to make the defaults more sane when create an issue in the context of a board
* During creation, call out whether an issue when created would be visible. This would be difficult as there is no JQL executor for an issue in Javascript.
* During creation, call out which fields need to be set in order to make the issue visible.
* After creation, add the issue into a "Purgatory" location in the backlog, which enables you to perform the required fix-ups from within GreenHopper instead of having to leave the context of the planning board.
fields.summary: Improve issue creation experience from planning board

fields.description:
*this is IE only* afaict

There is a bug/problem in Backbone.js that means it cant work properly with underscore.js 1.4.4.

Recently, greenhopper:
# started using underscore 1.4.4
# added a resource into the view-issue context that pulls in GH's underscore 1.4.4

There is no situation where GH should be including underscore on view-issue or issue-nav pages.
fields.summary: GH is including a different version of underscore.js on the view-issue and issue-nav pages in JDOG, breaking those pages in IE

fields.description: Quick create issue on the rapid board falls back to Epics every time.
fields.summary: jdog: Creating issues dialog always falls back to Epic issue type

fields.description:
At the moment, a user can modify the value for the story point upon including the story point field on the view/edit screen.  Since this is the case, a user can modify the story point value when a sprint has already started.  

It would be great to make the story point field to be read only after starting the sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the Story Points field Read-Only after Starting the Sprint in Scrum Board
quick filters based on fixVersions reset selected version
When closed and hit refresh, the panels are not horizontally aligned.
All issues, not All versions and All epics
Clicking a Version no longer does anything [video]
Versions are black, Epics are blue, I think this is a bug for you
Versions and labels not properly aligned.
Activating a quick filter in plan mode and then selecting a version cause the page to rerender
Dragging to a different Epic removes the Version label [video]
Epics list is completely missing, although there are epics on the board. On opening details view the epics come up.
